learning_outcomes.description: Demonstrate, through oral participation and written communication, knowledge of cutting-edge research projects that address issues in the study of Western Civilisation.
Understand the process of research project design and execution.
Evaluate the strengths and weaknesses of different methodological approaches to a research question.
Understand that different research questions require different methods and theories.
Develop skills in group work and oral presentations.

assessments.task_description: Participation is essential for passing this course, and requires you to interact respectfully and learn from your peers. Students are expected to participate in seminar discussions and relevant seminar tasks. This assessment requires you to show evidence of preparation for seminars and participate in small group discussions with relevant and well-focused comments.
assessments.submission_guidelines: You cannot defer or apply for an extension for this assessment.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You cannot defer or apply for an extension for this assessment.
assessments.late_submission: A penalty of 10% of the maximum possible mark will be deducted per 24 hours from time submission is due for up to 7 days. After 7 days, you will receive a mark of 0.
assessments.additional_info: You cannot defer or apply for an extension for this assessment.

assessments.due_date: Dates for presentations will be allocated at the first class session.
assessments.task_description: At the start of the semester, students will select one of the above works of reception on which to give an introductory ten-minute presentation. The presentation should introduce the background of the work in Roman historical sources, the modern context of its production, and its key features of interest. The presentation should be accompanied by a powerpoint.
assessments.submission_guidelines: You cannot defer or apply for an extension for this assessment.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You cannot defer or apply for an extension for this assessment.
assessments.late_submission: A penalty of 10% of the maximum possible mark will be deducted per 24 hours from time submission is due for up to 7 days. After 7 days, you will receive a mark of 0.
assessments.additional_info: You cannot defer or apply for an extension for this assessment.

assessments.due_date:
2/04/2026 8:00 am

Presentation will occur in final seminar.
assessments.task_description: Students will work in groups to present over 15 to 20 minutes a twenty-first reception of ancient Rome of their own choosing in light of the knowledge they have gained in the course about how to approach receptions of Rome.
assessments.submission_guidelines: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.late_submission: A penalty of 10% of the maximum possible mark will be deducted per 24 hours from time submission is due for up to 7 days. After 7 days, you will receive a mark of 0.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to apply for an extension.

assessments.task_description:
The topic of your essay will be developed in consultation with the course co-ordinator. Basic bibliography will be provided, however, students are expected to go beyond it in researching their topic. The essay should be between 2,000-2,500 words.


In addition to the submission of an essay, students will have a viva voce examination on their essay's content and research methodology. These will be scheduled following submission of the essay. The viva will be used to confirm grades awarded on the written assessment. Failure of the viva will result in the essay being awarded a failing grade. Further details in relation to the viva will be provided on the course website.
assessments.submission_guidelines: The Research Essay must be submitted through Turnitin before 14:00 PM on 29 April, 2025.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.late_submission: A penalty of 10% of the maximum possible mark will be deducted per 24 hours from time submission is due for up to 7 days. After 7 days, you will receive a mark of 0.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to apply for an extension.
